Body:
I am doing a coursera mooc.
I registered my raspberry pi as a gateway and as a senseHat device in my watson iot platform.
We can only define one device in /etc/iotsample-raspberrypi/device.cfg. I tried both but only the senseHat manages to register. Watson IoT Devices Then when connecting my raspberryPi as a gateway in Node-red it keep on failing with message:

15/12/2016 Ã  11:25:21msg : string [49]IBMIoT: Error: Connection refused: Not authorized I created an IoT node in my Raspberry node-red: gateway node

So what is the correct way to connect the senseHat onto my raspberry pi as a device and raspberry pi as gateway both in watson iot platform?

"
What credentials do you use to connect the PI in NodeRed? It should work fine if you connect it using an API Key and API Token.
Marc, if you can provide your 6 character org for your IoT service we may be able to confirm in the logs what credentials are failing.
I am using API Token for both (btw the same token)

Ok I got it. What I did (some step might not be necessary but doing this worked fine for me): 1. Remove any node in node-red using the device or gateway 2. Used the senHat device in :

/etc/iotsample-raspberrypi/device.cfg

3. stoped iot and nodered:

sudo service iot stop	node-red-stop
  1. started both iot and nodered
  2. added the nodes in nodered
"
Glad to hear it is working now!

I had a similar problem with this and struggled for about an hour. Sounds dumb, but if you are copying your credentials (I did so when following the online tutorial), it might introduce a space character before them in node-red. It was so small I didn't realize after a while, but it was keeping me from logging in.
